docs.snippet: The moment is ripe. The means are another matter.
A theater producer who wanted to cast Damien Geter as Nick in the Edward Albee play has ignited a debate over race and authorial control.

headline.print_headline: Albee Estate Rejects Bid to Cast Black Actor
headline.main: A Black Actor in ‘Virginia Woolf’? Not Happening, Albee Estate Says

docs.snippet: Mr. Colbert called the ousted Fox News commentator a “self-righteous landfill.” Then he got into his conservative pundit character and mourned.

docs.snippet: For some, Thursday’s testimony by James Comey was a moment of drama about President Trump. For others, it was a reflection that American governance had veered off the rails.

headline.print_headline: Comey Testimony Is a Prism for Viewing U.S. Politics
headline.main: Comey Testimony a Prism for Viewing American Politics

docs.snippet: Whether she was photographing graffiti and street games on New York’s Lower East Side, Martha Cooper’s images reflect her quest to show people and their culture in context.

headline.main: Graffiti, Games and Hip-Hop Culture: Finding Art on the Street

docs.abstract: Whether she was photographing graffiti and street games on New York’s Lower East Side, Martha Cooper’s images reflect her quest to show people and their culture in context.
